intro: Archibaccharis mucronata, commonly known as the narrowleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming during the warmer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. The plant's botanical features make it an attractive species for horticultural use in tropical and subtropical gardens.
